meanings.definition: To subtract or take away before calculating or determining a total.
meanings.sent1: She always prededucts the cost of shipping before finalizing her budget.
meanings.sent2: It is important to prededuct any discounts before calculating the final price.
meanings.sent3: The accountant prededucted the travel expenses with a smile, knowing it would save the company money.
meanings.sent4: His careful planning prededucts any unnecessary expenses, ensuring a smooth financial process.
meanings.sent5: Remember to prededuct taxes from your income to avoid any surprises at the end of the year.

meanings.definition: The amount that is subtracted or taken away before calculating a total.
meanings.sent1: The prededucts on the invoice were clearly listed for easy reference.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to include all prededucts when calculating the final cost of the project.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prededucts on the bill made everyone laugh at the accounting department's mistake.
meanings.sent4: The prededucts of time spent on unnecessary tasks can greatly improve productivity.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the prededucts in your budget can help you make better financial decisions.
